intro: Micromeria inodora, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Micromeria inodora is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
